releases.name: 0.0.1-alpha
releases.notesHtml:
• Added Features
  1. Documents
  • Store Request Data
  • Stores Response Data
  • Stores javascripts
  • Stores css styles
  1. Browser
  • Extension of the RestSharp RestClient
  • Generates Docuements for each web request.
  1. Javascript Engine
  • Used by the browser to scrape css styles from inline styles and linked styles.
  1. StyleEngine
  • Used by browser to scrape JavaScript content from inline scripts and externally linked scripts.

releases.name: 0.0.2-alpha
releases.notesHtml:
• Added Features
    Reworked browser entirely, no longer extends rest sharp client. Unit tests are passing for all Browser methods with the exception of the post methods. These will be tested before the next release.
    This version should be used over all previous releases, future versions will be backward compatible with this version.
  1. Documents
  • Store Request Data
  • Stores Response Data
  • Stores javascripts
  • Stores css styles
  1. Browser
  • Utilizes the RestSharp RestClient
  • Generates Docuements for each web request.
  • Supports asynchronous and synchronous
  1. Javascript Engine
  • Used by the browser to scrape css styles from inline styles and linked styles.
  • Scraping logic is implemented for asynchronous and synchronous browser requests
  1. StyleEngine
  • Used by browser to scrape JavaScript content from inline scripts and externally linked scripts.
  • Scraping logic is implemented for asynchronous and synchronous browser requests

1. Documents
  • Store Request Data
  • Stores Response Data
  • Stores javascripts
  • Stores css styles
  1. Browser
  • Supports asynchronous and synchronous web requests
  • Generates Documents for each web request.
  1. Javascript Engine
  • Used by browser to scrape JavaScript content from inline scripts and externally linked scripts.
  1. StyleEngine
  • Used by the browser to scrape css styles from inline styles and linked styles.

releases.name: 0.0.3-alpha
releases.notesHtml:
• Added convenience methods
  • Submit methods for post requests
  • Navigate methods for get requests
  • Updated browser initialization
  • Updated browser to initialize cookie container by default for automatic cookie management.

releases.name: 0.0.3-beta
releases.notesHtml:
• Added additional convenience methods
  • Submit methods for post requests
  • Added ability to set request headers
  • Added ability to add form data, sent as get request
  • Navigate methods for get requests
  • Added ability to set request headers

• Added convenience methods
  • Submit methods for post requests
  • Navigate methods for get requests
  • Added inline XML documentation for all files
    API Documentation can now be found at https://jayx239.github.io/BrowseSharp/

releases.name: 0.0.4-alpha
releases.notesHtml:
• Added Browse History Management Methods
  • Clear Histroy
  • Back
  • Forward
  • Set max history size
  • Updated Navigate and Submit methods to manage history
  • Note: Standard web request methods do not manage history currently, if you want history management to work properly stick to using the navigate and submit methods
  • Added the ability to disable javascript scraping and style scraping

releases.name: 0.0.4-beta
releases.notesHtml:
0.0.4-beta:

  • Added request uri to Document object.
  • Fixed bug with history management methods where request uri was not being set properly causing the previous url to be used in the request.

• Added request uri to Document object.
  • Fixed bug with history management methods where request uri was not being set properly causing the previous url to be used in the request.
  • Added Browse History Management Methods
  • Clear Histroy
  • Back
  • Forward
  • Set max history size
  • Updated Navigate and Submit methods to manage history
  • Note: Standard web request methods do not manage history currently, if you want history management to work properly stick to using the navigate and submit methods
  • Added the ability to disable javascript scraping and style scraping

releases.name: 0.0.5-alpha
releases.notesHtml:
Features:

  • Added Form model for storing form data
  • Added SubmitForm methods to browser for submitting the new Form model.
  • Added logic for scraping forms from each response and store it in a Document.
  • Added additional attributes to Document for easier access.

Bug fixes:

  • Fixed bug with UriHelper that was causing Uri's to be created incorrectly. Caused relative path script and css file links to be constructed incorrectly, resulting in these files not being retrieved properly and invalid requests to being made.

releases.name: 0.0.5-beta
releases.notesHtml:
• Updated browser submit and navigate methods to accept uri strings that do not contain a protocol. IE: you can pass www.google.com into the submit and navigate methods and it will automatically append the default protocol. The default protocol is set to http but can be set manually.

  • Updated UriHelper to have the Uri method which handles pre-pending the protocol to a uri if it is not present.

Features:

  • Updated browser submit and navigate methods to accept uri strings that do not contain a protocol. IE: you can pass www.google.com into the submit and navigate methods and it will automatically append the default protocol. The default protocol is set to http but can be set manually.
  • Updated UriHelper to have the Uri method which handles pre-pending the protocol to a uri if it is not present.
  • Added Form model for storing form data
  • Added SubmitForm methods to browser for submitting the new Form model.
  • Added logic for scraping forms from each response and store it in a Document.
  • Added additional attributes to Document for easier access.

Bug fixes:

  • Fixed bug with UriHelper that was causing Uri's to be created incorrectly. Caused relative path script and css file links to be constructed incorrectly, resulting in these files not being retrieved properly and invalid requests to being made.

releases.name: 0.0.6-alpha
releases.notesHtml:
Features:

  • Added type deserialization for browser methods.
    • You can now call a browser method with a given type and the response body will be deserialized into an object.
    • For example, if you call Document = Execute() you would be able retreive the Dog object from the response document by calling Dog dog = Document.Data;
      In progress:
  • There will be an additional 2 browsers with release 0.0.6
    • BrowserStandard - This will have the standard methods present in BrowseSharp versions prior to 0.0.6
    • BrowserTyped - This will have the Typed methods that are being added with this release
  • The Browser will have support for all of these methods.
